Customer Lifetime Value Prediction Project

Computational Statistics Framework for E-Commerce Customer Value Estimation

What This Project Is Asking For

This is a comprehensive data science/machine learning project that requires you to:

Build a Predictive Statistical Model

Create a mathematical framework to predict Customer Lifetime Value (CLV)

CLV = Total profit a customer will generate over their entire relationship with your business

This is a regression problem (predicting a continuous monetary value)

Use Real-World E-commerce Data

Work with actual transaction data (not just theoretical)

Handle real data challenges: missing values, outliers, data quality issues

Apply proper data preprocessing and feature engineering

Apply Data Science Techniques

Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Understand customer behavior patterns

Feature Engineering: Create meaningful variables (RFM: Recency, Frequency, Monetary)

Model Selection: Choose appropriate algorithms (statistical vs. ML approaches)

Model Validation: Prove your model works with proper testing methodology

Validate Predictions Rigorously

Use proper validation techniques (not just train/test split)

For CLV: temporal validation is crucial (train on past data, validate on future data)

Calculate meaningful metrics (MAE, RMSE, business impact)

What Type of Project This Is

This is a Production-Ready Business Analytics Project that combines:

Computational Statistics

  • BG/NBD Model (Beta Geometric/Negative Binomial Distribution)
  • Gamma-Gamma Model for monetary value
  • Survival Analysis concepts
  • Probabilistic modeling of customer behavior

Machine Learning

  • Supervised Learning (Regression)
  • Ensemble Methods (Random Forest, Gradient Boosting)
  • Feature Importance Analysis

Business Intelligence

  • Customer Segmentation based on predicted CLV
  • Marketing Budget Allocation recommendations
  • Customer Retention Strategies

MLOps/Production Considerations

  • Model Deployment readiness
  • Monitoring and retraining strategies
  • Scalability for large datasets

Academic vs. Industry Context

Context What's Expected
Academic Assignment Demonstrate understanding of CLV concepts, implement 1-2 models, basic validation
Industry Project Production-ready solution, business impact analysis, integration with marketing systems, ongoing monitoring

Core Technical Components You Must Include

1. Data Preparation

# RFM Analysis (Recency, Frequency, Monetary)
- Recency: Days since last purchase
- Frequency: Number of purchases
- Monetary: Average order value or total spend

2. Model Approaches

  • Statistical: BG/NBD + Gamma-Gamma (industry standard for CLV)
  • Machine Learning: Random Forest, XGBoost, Neural Networks
  • Hybrid: Combine both approaches

3. Validation Strategy

  • Temporal Split: Train on 2022 data, validate on 2023 data
  • Backtesting: Multiple time periods
  • Business Metrics: Not just RMSE, but ROI of marketing decisions

4. Business Application

  • Customer Segmentation: Champions, Loyal, At Risk, etc.
  • Marketing Recommendations: Budget allocation by segment
  • ROI Calculation: Expected return from targeting high-CLV customers

Expected Deliverables

Jupyter Notebook/Python Script

Complete analysis with code and explanations

Data Preprocessing Pipeline

Reusable pipeline for data cleaning and transformation

Multiple Model Implementations

With detailed comparison of approaches

Validation Results

With proper metrics and statistical significance

Customer Segmentation

With business recommendations for each segment

Visualizations

Showing insights and model performance

Documentation

Explaining methodology and business impact

Why This Project Matters

CLV prediction is one of the most valuable applications of data science in e-commerce because:

Marketing Efficiency

Spend more on high-value customers, less on low-value ones

Customer Retention

Identify at-risk high-value customers early

Inventory Planning

Better demand forecasting by customer segment

Product Development

Focus on features that high-CLV customers want

Investor Relations

Demonstrate customer base quality and growth potential

  • Handle real-world data complexities

  • Deliver actionable business insights

Difficulty Level: Advanced
